00034 ### for handling multivalued functions of a complex variable
00035 ###### subroutines ###########
00036 sub pg_mod {      #calculate complex number mod $b i.e $a = k$b + ($a mod $b) for some integer k
00037         my $a =shift;
00038         my $b =shift;
00039         return $a if $b ==0;  # modulo 0 returns $a itself.
00040         $a-int(Complex($a/$b)->Re)*$b;  
00041                 #int takes the integer real part of a complex number
00042 }
00043     
00044 sub compareMod {
00045     my $mod_factor = shift;
00046     sub {
00047         my ($correct, $response, $ans_checker) = @_;        
00048         my $New_Comp;
00049         # my $residue = pg_mod ($correct - $response, $mod_factor);
00050         #($residue == Complex(0,0)) ? 1:0;
00051         
00052         
00053         
00054         if($mod_factor->isComplex)  {
00055             my $Abs_mod_factor = sqrt((($mod_factor)->Re)**2+(($mod_factor)->Im)**2);
00056         $New_Comp = $Abs_mod_factor + ($Abs_mod_factor)*i;
00057       } else        {       
00058         $New_Comp = $mod_factor;      
00059       }
00060          
00061          my $residue = pg_mod ($correct - $response + ($New_Comp / 2), $mod_factor);
00062         ($residue == ($New_Comp)/2) ? 1:0;
00063     
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 sub uniqueList {
00068     my $ra_list = shift;
00069     my $rf_equiv = shift;
00070     my $listSize = @$ra_list;
00071     my @equalPairs = ();
00072     my ($i,$j);
00073     for ($i=0;  $i<$listSize; $i++) {
00074         for($j=$i+1;  $j<$listSize; $j++) {
00075             push( @equalPairs, [$i,$j] ) if &$rf_equiv($ra_list->[$i],$ra_list->[$j]);
00076         }
00077     }
00078     @equalPairs;
00079 
00080 }

00087 sub compareListsMod {
00088     my $alpha = shift;             # responses in list are compared mod $alpha to the correct answers
00089     my $equiv = shift || "2pi*i";  # responses in list are considered duplicates if they are equivalent mod $equiv
00090     $alpha = Complex($alpha); $equiv = Complex($equiv);
00091     my $cmp_mod_alpha = compareMod($alpha);  # this must be the smallest interval mod 2pi
00092     my $cmp_mod2pi = compareMod($equiv);
00093     sub {
00094         my ($correct, $student, $ans) = @_;
00095         my @equalPairs = uniqueList($student, $cmp_mod2pi);
00096         if (@equalPairs) {
00097             my $msg = "";
00098             for my $pair (@equalPairs) {
00099                 my ($pos1, $pos2) = @$pair;
00100                 $msg .= $student->[$pos1]." and ".$student->[$pos2]. " are equivalent.  ";
00101             }
00102             Value::Error("Some of your answers are equivalent. ".$msg);
00103             return 0
00104         } else {
00105             my $result=0; my $msg = '';
00106             my @correct = @$correct; my @student=@$student;
00107             return 0 unless scalar(@correct) == scalar(@student);
00108             foreach my $i (0..$#correct) {
00109                 if ( &$cmp_mod_alpha($correct[$i],$student[$i]) ) {
00110                     $result++ 
00111                 } else {
00112                     $msg .= "Your $i answer is incorrect. ";
00113                 }
00114             }
00115             Value::Error($msg) unless $result == @correct;
00116             return $result;
00117         }
00118     }
00119 
00120 
00121 }

00123 sub compareFormulaMod {
00124     sub {
00125         my ($correct, $student, $ans) = @_;
00126         my $result = 1;
00127         #  evaluate the formulas at 0 and 1 to find coefficients of powers of k
00128         my $correct_a0 = $correct->eval(k=>0);
00129         my $student_a0 = $student->eval(k=>0);
00130         my $correct_a1 = $correct->eval(k=>1) - $correct_a0;
00131         my $student_a1 = $student->eval(k=>1) - $student_a0;
00132         
00133         
00134         my $cmp_mod = compareMod($correct_a1);
00135         &$cmp_mod($correct_a0, $student_a0) && (
00136         
00137         #&cmp($correct_a0,$student_a0) && (     
00138                   $correct_a1 == $student_a1 or $correct_a1 == - $student_a1
00139                   # - $student_a1 to make sure it is equal to correct_a1 rather than a multiple of it.
00140         );
00141     }
00142 
00143 }
